text:
I noticed you get as many chunks in chunk-encoded output as calls to php's 
echo/write. This may lead to very small chunks and a lot of overhead.

(I was actually trying to figure out -unsuccesfully- why my php-generated-pdf's 
no longer open in IE adobe plugin, suspecting it had something to to with the 
chunk-encoding, I stumbled on the small chunk size by accident)
creator: jr@marvel-databadge.com
slive@apache.org
text:
If I am not mistaken, this is a deliberate design decision by the
php developers (they send a "flush bucket" after each write).

Given that, you really need to take this up with the php people.
